intro: Phegopteris bukoensis, commonly known as the Buko fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Dicksoniaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound fronds. The plant has a robust root system that helps it thrive in moist, shaded environments. Its fronds are typically dark green and can reach lengths of up to 3 meters. Phegopteris bukoensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
